maml:description.maml:para: Get git project status.

Presumably you are using git to manage your project. If so, some git-related information is included in the PSProjectStatus output. Get-PSProjectGitStatus is intended to provide more git-specific details. You should run this command in the root of your project directory. If the project is not git initialized, nothing will be returned.

maml:alert.maml:para: This command has an alias of gitstat.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\Scripts\PSProjectStatus> Get-PSProjectGitStatus
Name Branch LastCommit Remote ---- ------ ---------- ------ PSProjectStatus 0.6.0 3/29/2022 5:23:20 PM @{RemoteName=origin; LastPush=3/26/2022 10:36:00 AM}

maml:description.maml:para: Manage all your PSProject folders.

The PSProjectStatus module makes an assumption that the majority of your projects are organized under a parent folder like C:\Scripts. This command is designed to make it easier to identify and manage projects you are working on. The default behavior is to get PSProject information from the top-level folders in your root directory. But you can also filter on status, age, or tag.
Specify the top level folder
Get projects where the age is newer than X number of days
Filter projects by status
Get projects with a specific tag. You can combine this with other filtering parameters.
Specify the top level folder
Get projects where the age is older than X number of days
Filter projects by status
Get projects with a specific tag. You can combine this with other filtering parameters.
Get projects where the age is newer than X number of days
Get projects where the age is older than X number of days
Specify the top level folder
Filter projects by status
Get projects with a specific tag. You can combine this with other filtering parameters.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSProjectReport c:\scripts -Status Other
Name: PSMessaging [C:\Scripts\PSMessaging]
LastUpdate Status Tasks GitBranch Age ---------- ------ ----- --------- --- 7/20/2022 11:58:54 AM Other {} master 192.02:11

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get PSProject information based on a status.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PSProjectReport c:\scripts -NewerThan 10 -Status Stable
Name: PluralsightTools [C:\Scripts\PluralsightTools]
LastUpdate Status Tasks GitBranch Age ---------- ------ ----- --------- --- 1/20/2023 2:20:39 PM Stable {convert modu... main 07.23:51

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get PSProjects modified within the last 10 days.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C>\> Get-PSProjectReport c:\scripts -NewerThan 60 | Select-Object Path,Name,Status,Tags,LastUpdate | Out-GridView -Title "Select a project" -OutputMode Single | Foreach-Object { set-location $_.path ; code $_.path }

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get projects modified in the last 60 days and send to Out-GridView. The selected project folder will be opened in VSCode.

maml:description.maml:para: Get project status.

This command will get the project status from the JSON file found in the module root directory. Get-PSProjectStatus will check the current directory by default, or you can specify the parent path of another directory.
Enter the parent path to the psproject.json file, e.g. c:\scripts\mymodule
Enter the parent path to the psproject.json file, e.g. c:\scripts\mymodule

maml:alert.maml:para: This command has an alias of gpstat.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\Scripts\PSClock> Get-PSProjectStatus
Name: PSClock [C:\Scripts\PSClock]
LastUpdate Status Tasks GitBranch Age ---------- ------ ----- --------- --- 10/17/2024 1:00:56 PM Stable {Pester tests} main 80.20:40

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the status from the current directory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
C:\Scripts\ dir -Directory | Get-PSProjectStatus -WarningAction SilentlyContinue
Name: ADReportingTools [C:\Scripts\ADReportingTools]
LastUpdate Status Tasks GitBranch Age ---------- ------ ----- --------- --- 6/21/2021 4:47:11 PM Updating {Publish new re… 1.4.0 266.17:59
Name: GitDevTest [C:\scripts\GitDevTest]
LastUpdate Status Tasks GitBranch Age ---------- ------ ----- --------- --- 2/3/2022 4:50:37 PM Stable {update readme,… master 39.17:55
Name: MyTasks [C:\Scripts\MyTasks]
LastUpdate Status Tasks GitBranch Age ---------- ------ ----- --------- --- 10/14/2020 1:29:59 PM Stable master 516.21:16 ...

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get status for multiple projects. You could also use the Get-PSProjectReport command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\Scripts\PSCalendar> Get-PSProjectStatus | Format-List
Project: PSCalendar [C:\scripts\PSCalendar]
Version : 2.9.0 Status : Stable Tasks : {Update Help, Issue 34} Tags : {} GitBranch : master LastUpdate : 3/1/2022 5:50:00 AM Age : 669.10:07:19

dev:remarks.maml:para: Use the default List view. This makes it easier to view the tasks.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\Scripts\PSProjectStatus> Get-PSProjectStatus | Select-Object VersionInfo,Age
Name : PSProjectStatus Status : Updating Version : 0.5.0 GitBranch : 0.5.0 LastUpdate : 3/23/2022 11:30:42 AM Age : 00:06:06.2337458

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get status using the versionInfo property set and the Age script property.

maml:description.maml:para: List project tasks
List defined tasks in the PSProject file. You will get a warning if no tasks are defined.
Enter the parent path to the psproject.json file, e.g. c:\scripts\mymodule.
Get a task by its ID number
Enter the parent path to the psproject.json file, e.g. c:\scripts\mymodule.
Get a task by its ID number

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\PSWorkItem> Get-PSProjectTask
Name: PSWorkItem [C:\PSWorkItem]
Show overdue value in table in red [1] Pester tests [2] Show tooltip help in TUI [3] Add option in TUI to filter table by days [4]

dev:remarks.maml:para: Display tasks. If you run this in the console of VSCode, you should get ANSI formatted output. The number in brackets is the TaskID.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\PSWorkItem> Get-PSProjectTask -TaskID 2
Name: PSWorkItem [C:\PSWorkItem]
Pester tests [2]

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a task by ID number.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new PSProjectStatus.

Create a new PSProject file. Ideally, you will run this command in the module root directory. The module manifest, if found, will be used for the Project Version. If a git branch is detected, it will automatically be used.
The command will not overwrite an existing PSProjectStatus file. If you want to overwrite an existing file, use the -Force parameter.
What is the project name? The default is the current folder name.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
When was the project last worked on?
What is the project path?
What is the project status? Accepted values are Development, Updating, Stable, AlphaTesting, BetaTesting, ReleaseCandidate, Patching, UnitTesting, AcceptanceTesting, and Other.
What are the remaining tasks?
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
What is the project version? The default value will be detected from a module manifest if found.
Enter an optional comment. This could be git tag, or an indication about the type of project.
Overwrite an existing PSProjectStatus file.
What tags do you want to assign to this project?
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
When was the project last worked on?
What is the project name? The default is the current folder name.
What is the project path?
What is the project status? Accepted values are Development, Updating, Stable, AlphaTesting, BetaTesting, ReleaseCandidate, Patching, UnitTesting, AcceptanceTesting, and Other.
What are the remaining tasks?
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
What is the project version? The default value will be detected from a module manifest if found.
Enter an optional comment. This could be git tag, or an indication about the type of project.
Overwrite an existing PSProjectStatus file.
What tags do you want to assign to this project?

maml:alert.maml:para: This command has an alias of npstat.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\Projects\Contoso> New-PSProjectStatus
Name: Contoso [C:\Projects\Contoso]
LastUpdate Status Tasks GitBranch Age ---------- ------ ----- --------- --- 12/22/2023 8:35:55 AM Development {} main 00.00:00

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new project status using default values.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\Scripts\PSScriptingInventory> New-PSProjectStatus -LastUpdate (Get-Item .\PSScriptingInventory.psd1).LastWriteTime -Status Stable -Comment "Script module"
Name: PSScriptingInventory [C:\scripts\PSScriptingInventory]
LastUpdate Status Tasks GitBranch Age ---------- ------ ----- --------- --- 6/19/2020 8:42:04 AM Stable {} main 634.01:13

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new project status. PSDrive references will be converted to filesystem paths. The Age property is automatically calculated from the LastUpdate value.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new task in the PSProject file.
You can add tasks directly in the PSProject file, or you can use this function. Specify a task description and it will be added to the PSProject file. The task ID is assigned automatically.
You can also use Set-PSProjectTask set tasks.
Enter the task description.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Display the new task.
Enter the parent path to the psproject.json file, e.g. c:\scripts\mymodule.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Display the new task.
Enter the parent path to the psproject.json file, e.g. c:\scripts\mymodule.
Enter the task description.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
C:\Scripts\PSProjectStatus> New-PSProjectTask -TaskDescription "Pester tests" -PassThru
Name: PSProjectStatus [C:\Scripts\PSProjectStatus]
Pester tests [7]

maml:description.maml:para: Open the PSProjectStatus help document
Use this command to open the PDF help document for the PSProjectStatus module with the associated application for PDF files. As an alternative you can view the documentation as a markdown document.
Open the help file as markdown.
Open the help file as markdown.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The file should open in the default application for PDF files.
View the help file a markdown document.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove a task from the PSProject file.
You can manually remove tasks from the PSProject file, or you can use this function. Specify a task ID and it will be removed from the PSProject file.
Enter the task ID
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Enter the parent path to the psproject.json file, e.g. c:\scripts\mymodule.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Enter the parent path to the psproject.json file, e.g. c:\scripts\mymodule.
Enter the task ID
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Remove tasks 4 and 2 from the PSProject file.

maml:description.maml:para: Update a PSProject status.

Use this command to update a PSProject status. If a git branch is detected, it will automatically be used. Ideally, you will run Set-PSProjectStatus from the module root directory. You can always manually modify the psproject.json file in your editor. To manually update the LastUpdate value, convert a datetime value to JSON.
Get-Date -format o | Set-Clipboard
Manually copy the value into the JSON file.
The Status value is an integer indicating a private enumeration value.
- Development = 0
- Updating = 1
- Stable = 2
- AlphaTesting = 3
- BetaTesting = 4
- ReleaseCandidate = 5
- Patching = 6
- UnitTesting = 7
- AcceptanceTesting = 8
- Other = 9
Enter one of these string values. If you edit the file in VSCode, it should detect the JSON schema and provide completion values.

command:parameter.maml:name: InputObject

maml:description.maml:para: Specify a PSProject object.

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: PSProject file in the current directory

maml:description.maml:para: What is the project name?
When was the project last worked on or updated?
What are the remaining tasks?
What is the project status? Accepted values are Development, Updating, Stable, AlphaTesting, BetaTesting, ReleaseCandidate, Patching, UnitTesting, AcceptanceTesting, and Other.
Concatenate new tasks.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
What is the project version?
Enter an optional comment. This could be git tag, or an indication about the type of project.
What tags do you want to assign to this project? If you want to append tags you either have to re-define all tags, or add a tag manually to the psproject.json file.
Concatenate new tasks.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

command:parameter.maml:name: InputObject

maml:description.maml:para: Specify a PSProject object.

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: PSProject file in the current directory

maml:description.maml:para: When was the project last worked on or updated?
What is the project name?
What is the project status? Accepted values are Development, Updating, Stable, AlphaTesting, BetaTesting, ReleaseCandidate, Patching, UnitTesting, AcceptanceTesting, and Other.
What are the remaining tasks?
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
What is the project version?
Enter an optional comment. This could be git tag, or an indication about the type of project.
What tags do you want to assign to this project? If you want to append tags you either have to re-define all tags, or add a tag manually to the psproject.json file.

maml:alert.maml:para: This command has an alias of spstat.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\Scripts\PSProjectStatus> Set-PSProjectStatus -Status Development -comment (git tag -l | Select-Object -last 1)
Name: PSProjectStatus [C:\scripts\PSProjectStatus]
LastUpdate Status Tasks GitBranch Age ---------- ------ ----- --------- --- 3/15/2023 10:09:05 AM Develo.. {help docs, readm… 0.2.0 00.00:00

dev:remarks.maml:para: Update the project status using the current date and time. Set the Status property to Development and use the last git tag as a comment.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\Scripts\PSProjectStatus> Set-PSProjectStatus -Status Development -Tasks "github" -Concatenate | Format-List
Project: PSProjectStatus [C:\scripts\PSProjectStatus]
Version : 0.5.0 Status : Updating Tasks : {help docs, readme, pester tests, resolve project path for json…} GitBranch : 0.5.0 LastUpdate : 3/23/2023 10:20:26 AM

dev:remarks.maml:para: Update the project and add a task.
